title: Wake up to agrarian crisis, farmers tell govt
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, September 30
Farmers in large numbers today held protests across the state against the alleged anti-farmer policies of the state government. The protesters were backed by several farmer unions as well as other organisations. Most leaders sought to draw attention of the state government towards the worsening farm crisis. Highway choked
Phagwara: Hundreds of activists belonging to the Bhartiya Kisan Union today staged a demonstration and blocked traffic on the Goraya-Phillaur stretch of the national highway for three hours. The blockade continued from noon till 3 pm, causing inconvenience to commuters. The Indo-Pakistan buses were diverted from Amritsar via the Tarn Taran-Moga route. The traffic from Goraya to Ludhiana was diverted throught other routes. Unionâ€™s state general secretary Pooran Singh Shahkoti, Jalandhar district president Amrik Singh, Nawanshahr president Ranjit Singh, Tarn Taran president Dilbag Singh, Amritsar president Ajmer Singh and Gurdaspur president Gurnam Singh addressed the rally at the dharna site and demanded immediate implementation of the Swaminathan committee report. The protesters said their issues, including compensation for damaged cotton crop, low price offered for potato, basmati and sugarcane, were not being addressed. The protesters finally gave a memorandum of their demands to the ADC and SDM.
